The spec says the following for using CodeSystem supplements (https://www.hl7.org/fhir/codesystem.html#supplements) -

The CodeSystem.url for a supplement must be under the control of the authority creating or publishing the supplement (e.g. not in the same space as the code system being supplemented, unless the supplement is being issued by the same authority as the original code system

Does that mean that if I make a supplement that contains eg. translations for another language for eg. http://hl7.org/fhir/address-use - should that Codesystem supplement then be under the authority of HL7 (and not eg. the affiliate that provided the codesystem supplement)?

(Tagging you @Lloyd McKenzie as you usually have an oppinion on these matters)

no it means you have to use a URL you have control over if you publish the supplement. If you do it through an HL7 Committee, then yes, ues an HL7 namespace. If you do it through the affiliate, use their name space

Ok - ... I was just about to post a follow question but I think I found the answer:
image.png
So ... is it correctly understood that it is currently implementation specific in terms of how supplements are used during expansion?
i think that's overstating it. We're still figuring it out. that's not the same as 'implementation specific'

Grahame's got it right. The URL for the supplement should be based on "who's responsible for authoring the supplement" - which might not have any correlation with the URL of the code system being supplemented.
@Grahame Grieve is the progress of figuring it out tracked on a jira?

What the dragon is saying is "We don't have a ton of experience with supplements yet - as we learn more, things may change". Certainly if someone identifies problems with how supplements are working now, a Jira ticket would presumably be spawned at some point.
I do not think that there's a specific jira task. It would be a question to ask on #terminology
Jens Villadsen has marked this topic as resolved.

Followup suggestion for improving use of supplements: Add an invariant that safeguards that if the Codesystem.content = ' supplement' then the CodeSystem.supplement cannot be empty - essentially enforcing one of the rules on http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/codesystem.html#supplements. Would you like this in a jira if you agree?
